# Samuel Oshin — Backend Engineer Portfolio (Full Content)

> Python Backend Engineer specializing in AI/LLM infrastructure, RAG pipelines, and distributed systems. 2× HNG Finalist, Top 1-5% of 10,000+ developers.

## About Samuel Oshin

Samuel Oshin is a Python Backend Engineer with expertise in:
- RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pipeline design and deployment
- Distributed systems architecture
- AI-powered backend infrastructure
- FastAPI, Django, and Python web frameworks
- Vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, ChromaDB)
- LLM integration and orchestration (LangChain, LlamaIndex)
- Database design (PostgreSQL, Redis, SQLAlchemy)
- Cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Vercel)

## Blog Posts

### Building RAG Pipelines at Scale
URL: https://samueloshin.vercel.app/blog/building-rag-pipelines-at-scale
Published: 2026-02-28
Tags: RAG, AI, Python, LangChain, Vector Databases

A comprehensive guide to building production RAG pipelines covering:
- The five core stages: Document Ingestion, Chunking, Embedding, Retrieval, Generation
- Chunking strategies: fixed-size vs semantic vs parent-child
- Embedding model selection and benchmarks (text-embedding-3-large, voyage-large-2, bge-large-en-v1.5)
- Evaluation framework using RAGAS metrics (answer relevancy, faithfulness, context precision/recall)
- Production lessons: caching, hybrid search, fallback strategies, drift monitoring

### Python Backend Best Practices in 2026
URL: https://samueloshin.vercel.app/blog/python-backend-best-practices-2026
Published: 2026-02-25
Tags: Python, Backend, FastAPI, Architecture

Battle-tested patterns for production Python backends covering:
- Project structure that scales (routes → services → repositories pattern)
- Async done right: avoiding event loop blocking
- FastAPI dependency injection patterns
- Structured logging with structlog
- Error handling strategies with custom exception hierarchies
- Recommended production tool stack (FastAPI, SQLAlchemy 2.0, Alembic, Pydantic v2, Ruff)
